metadata.synopsis: Patron chatter on Elfsong Tavern - Caitriono

0.speaker: Caitriono
0.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

1.speaker: Caitriono
1.text: I pity whoever it was rented out the upper floor. Know why? Rats. Place is full of 'em.
1.context: InternalNodeContext: The players paid for exclusive use of Elfsong Tavern first floor.

2.speaker: Caitriono
2.text: I liked the city better when it was gloomy, before Umberlee banished the fogs. Sunlight just makes my eyes water. Luckily, it's still gloomy in here.
2.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

3.speaker: Caitriono
3.text: Gortash, an Archduke? Saw him once, at a distance - looked like too much of a pipsqueak to fill those boots.
3.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

4.speaker: Caitriono
4.text: If Lorroakan was so smart, he'd have stuck with pulling rabbits out of hats. Instead, he had to try sawing a celestial in half. Haw!
4.context: InternalNodeContext: Lorroakan has been deposed from Ramazith's Tower + no longer owns Sorcerous Sundries

5.speaker: Caitriono
5.text: They say Lord Gortash is dead. It's probably true - aim high, fall hard.

6.speaker: Caitriono
6.text: I wonder if this Rolan feller is buying magic rings? And if so, where can I get one?
6.context: InternalNodeContext: Rolan as new owner of Sorcerous Sundries

7.speaker: Caitriono
7.text: Fame turned to ashes in your mouth yet?
7.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's Mouth

8.speaker: Caitriono
8.text: So the Sundries has new management! I tried to sell a magic ring I found in an alley to Lorroakan, once, and the hell boar threw me out.
8.context: InternalNodeContext: Rolan as new owner of Sorcerous Sundries

9.speaker: Caitriono
9.text: Big commotion out in Grey Harbour, according to the B-Mouth. I figure it's just Ol' Cholms having indigestion.
9.context: InternalNodeContext: Iron Throne Destruction (ie. vague trouble in harbour)

10.speaker: Caitriono
10.text: There's so many rats in the Elfsong Tavern, I hear the cook wants to hire a rat-catcher. I'd apply, but I fear I'm over-qualified.
10.context: InternalNodeContext: The players paid for exclusive use of Elfsong Tavern first floor.

11.speaker: Caitriono
11.text: Well, of course the Steel Watchers have come to nothing. Gondians, always mucketing about with gears and widgets. What good has it ever done us?

12.speaker: Caitriono
12.text: And so Lorroakan meets the fate of all ambitious wizards! They're mostly frauds, you know, wizards. Abracadabra, my arse.
12.context: InternalNodeContext: Lorroakan has been deposed from Ramazith's Tower + no longer owns Sorcerous Sundries

13.speaker: Caitriono
13.text: Don't tell anyone I called Archduke Gortash a pipsqueak, all right? Thanks.
13.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

14.speaker: Caitriono
14.text: From what I read in Baldur's Mouth, I'd bet you're pretty pleased with yourself. Good luck with that. Doesn't last.
14.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's Mouth

15.speaker: Caitriono
15.text: You know about Ol' Cholms, right? The gigantic snapping turtle in Grey Harbour? Ah, never mind.
15.context: InternalNodeContext: Iron Throne Destruction (ie. vague trouble in harbour)

16.speaker: Caitriono
16.text: Now that I think about it, I wonder if any of those busted Watchers have valuable parts. Loose and removable, as it were.

17.speaker: Caitriono
17.text: If Gortash is dead, it'll mean the other dukes will be vying for power again. Plague take all of 'em.
